title: 20. Do Our Politics Need a Doctor?
description: Bill Frist was a transplant surgeon before serving in the Senate, where he drove controversial legislation on embryonic stem cells and end-of-life care. Did he change politics? Or did politics change him?
author: bapu@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Bill Frist was a transplant surgeon before serving in the Senate, where he drove controversial legislation on embryonic stem cells and end-of-life care. Did he change politics? Or did politics change him?
